Name: Artemis IV Fire Control System
Details: Introduced 2598, lost 2855, and reintroduced 3035, the Artemis IV Fire Control System (FCS) is a guidance system designed for use with missile weaponry, such as Short-Range Missiles (SRM) or Long-Range Missiles (LRM). When attached to a launcher, the FCS grants the use of Artemis-enabled missiles, which benefit from massively increased accuracy and shot grouping.
